technical.focal_length: 35-85mm for landscapes, 85-135mm for portraits, wide angles (14-35mm) for dramatic scenes
technical.depth_of_field: Variable - shallow for portraits (f/1.4-2.8), moderate to deep for landscapes (f/5.6-11)
technical.shutter_speed: 1/60-1/500s typically, faster for moving subjects, slower with tripods for landscapes
technical.lighting: Natural sunlight 30-60 minutes after sunrise or before sunset, backlighting and rim lighting emphasized
technical.camera_format: Full frame preferred for dynamic range, APS-C and mirrorless common, film creates distinctive warmth

aesthetic.composition: Rule of thirds, leading lines toward sun, silhouettes, sun positioning at intersections or edges
aesthetic.subject_background: Subjects often backlit or rim-lit against warm sky, silhouettes common, bokeh emphasized
aesthetic.tonal_range: High contrast between shadows and highlights, lifted shadows in post, gradual tonal transitions
aesthetic.color_approach: Warm color palette dominated by oranges, yellows, deep blues, enhanced saturation and vibrance
aesthetic.texture_detail: Soft, diffused textures, rim lighting reveals edge detail, atmospheric haze reduces contrast

shooting_approach.subject_distance: Varies widely - close portraits to distant landscapes, often determined by desired sun size
shooting_approach.angle_perspective: Low angles common to include foreground, shooting toward or across light source
shooting_approach.subject_relationship: Both posed and candid, romantic and intimate mood, relaxed positioning
shooting_approach.environment: Outdoor locations exclusively, open fields, beaches, urban rooftops, anywhere with horizon access

context.historical_context: Popularized in film era, massively expanded with digital photography and social media (2010s onward)
context.key_characteristics: Warm color temperature, dramatic lighting ratios, ethereal quality, consistent timing requirements
context.related_styles: Blue hour photography, backlit photography, sunset photography, romantic portraiture

era_variants.notes: Film era emphasized natural warmth, digital era allows extreme color grading, Instagram era popularized heavy orange/teal processing
